thread.title: Firefighters bring blaze on Hobart's eastern shore under control
thread.title_full: Firefighters bring blaze on Hobart's eastern shore under control

title: Firefighters bring blaze on Hobart's eastern shore under control
text:
Fire near Lindisfarne in Hobart brought under control, no damage to property Updated February 15, 2017 20:53:36 External Link: Tweet showing flames near a house in Lindisfarne 
The Tasmania Fire Service (TFS) has downgraded the fire at Lindisfarne on Hobart's eastern shore to advice level. 
Several tankers and five aircraft have been fighting the vegetation blaze at Tianna Road, which started about 4:30pm. 
A total fire ban had been declared for the state's south because of dangerous conditions. 
Crews have been back burning in the area around Natone Hill and will monitor the fire overnight. 
Aircraft were used to protect property, including nearby communication towers. 
Some residents in Tianna Road chose to evacuate with their pets but properties were not threatened. 
A total fire ban is in force in southern Tasmania because of hot and windy conditions. Photo: One resident said it was a nerve-wracking drive home. (Supplied: Toby O'Donnell) 
It is due to be lifted at midnight on Wednesday. 
The fire started on the northern flank of Natone Hill and ran down the southern side, burning an area of 25 hectares. 
TFS spokesman Simon Pilkington said the fire was not as big as it first appeared. 
Winds were expected to ease about 9:00pm. Photo: Paul Robinson from the Taroona Volunteer Brigade takes a break after the alert. (Supplied: Chris Walter) 
One resident, Stephanie, who lives on Tianna Road said it was an overwhelming sight to drive home to. 
"Coming home, all I could think was I've just got to get my dogs and everything else is just stuff," she said. 
"So whatever happens, it's just stuff. I'm just a bit overwhelmed at the moment. Photo: A total of five aircraft were brought in to fight the fire at Lindisfarne. (ABC News) 
"When I went up to the house, the fire was very, very, close to our house so that's got me a little bit worried." 
The temperature in Hobart reached 26 degrees Celsius this afternoon, with winds gusting up to 60 kilometres per hour.
